intro: Metastelma bahamense, commonly known as the Bahamian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Metastelma bahamense is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a rare species within its native range.
